name: DOUBLE Antique IRON lion bird tree front French WOOd ENTRY vintage Door 1800's Ohio
description:
These front entryway doors once graced " Childhurst ", of the Childs-Knox House , in Painesville , Ohio. The house's lineage traces itself back to one of Painesvilles most prominent citizens . 
Isaac Gillet[te] was one of the towns most prominent early merchants . 

The doorway to his house [ now demolished ] is displayed in the Cleveland Museum of Art . 
His daughter married Fred Wilkes of the Wilkes and Coe [ later Coe ] Manufacturing Company . 

Their daughter married Mr. Childs , a prominent Painesville resident and Trustee of Lake Erie Female Seminary .

 The house from which these doors were removed , was built by Mr. Wilkes for his daughter [ Mrs. Childs]. 


The Child's daughter married William Knox , an important Architect , who designed , in Cleveland , the Rockerfeller Building at West 6th and Superior for John D. Rockerfeller . Knox had come to Cleveland , after a career which began in Chicago , because his in-laws lived here and gave them this house " Childhurst . 

Now about the doors .

 People who have looked at these doors don't have a concensus of what type of wood they are . I have been told they are Oak , Ash or Chestnut which are all very similar in appearance except Chestnut is now extinct . 

The height of both doors is 89 1/2" with a combined width of 62" . The doors are 1 3/4" thick but if you include the decorative molding they are 3 3/4" thick . 

They each have a glass window / door that is mounted on the inside face , of the doors , and is 43" high by 18 1/2" wide .

 I call them little doors because the open , on the inside , like doors 

. On the outside of these "little doors" are Cast Iron Decorative Screens . 

If you look closely you can see like a tree being held up by Lions legs , Birds of Paradise Flowers and designs . 

The Cast Iron screens are 3/8" thick .

 The door with the bolt at the top and bottom is 31 1/2" wide plus a 1/2" overlap piece .

 The door with the doorknob is 30 1/2" wide . 
These can be used anywhere though 

All offers are considered only a question 

Need a home they are to beautiful for storage 

Buyer pays shipper freight 

Located 15 minutes from Cleveland Ohio 

It is in a heated warehouse so a truck can pull right in to pick up.. 

I will help where possible... We may have someone to meet you for a price depending where you live  in cleveland ohio You will have to pay bid price and expenses first.. 
More pictures needed please contact me direct
